AKS_Resiliency_MinNodesPerPool.explanation: The cluster should have at least 3 nodepools for high availability.

AKS_Running.explanation: The cluster should be running to get accurate results. Some results might be wrong due to the current state.

AKS_Provisioned.explanation: The cluster should be provisioned to get accurate results. Some results might be wrong due to the current state.

AKS_Resiliency_Autoscaling.explanation: Autoscaling should be enabled in the cluster for all nodepools. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/cluster-autoscaler

AKS_Resiliency_AvailabilityZones.explanation: Availability zones should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/availability-zones

AKS_Resiliency_UserNodePools.explanation: User node pools should be used in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools

AKS_Resiliency_Backup.explanation: Backups should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/backup/azure-kubernetes-service-cluster-manage-backups

AKS_Private_Cluster.explanation: The cluster should be private. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/private-clusters

AKS_Private_FQDN.explanation: The cluster should have a private FQDN. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/private-clusters?tabs=azure-portal#disable-a-public-fqdn

AKS_Private_NoPublicLoadBalancer.explanation: Public load balancers should not be used in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/internal-lb

AKS_Network_StandardLoadBalancer.explanation: Standard load balancers should be used in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/load-balancer/load-balancer-standard-overview

AKS_Network_Policies.explanation: Network policies should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-network-policies

AKS_Network_CNIOverlay.explanation: The cluster should use the Azure CNI Overlay network plugin. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/azure-cni-overlay

AKS_Performance_EphemeralOSDisk.explanation: Ephemeral OS disks should be used in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/samples/azure-samples/aks-ephemeral-os-disk/aks-ephemeral-os-disk/

AKS_Compliance_KubernetesVersionSupporte.explanation: The Kubernetes version used in the cluster should be supported by AKS. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/supported-kubernetes-versions

AKS_Compliance_AutoUpgradeEnabled.explanation: Auto-upgrade should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/auto-upgrade-cluster

AKS_Compliance_SLA.explanation: The cluster should have a service level agreement (SLA). For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/free-standard-pricing-tiers

AKS_Compliance_AzurePolicyEnabled.explanation: Azure Policy should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-azure-policy

AKS_Addon_ContainerInsights.explanation: Azure Monitor for containers should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/insights/container-insights-overview

AKS_Addon_DiagnosticSettings.explanation: Diagnostic settings should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/create-diagnostic-settings

AKS_Addon_Defender.explanation: Microsoft Defender for Containers should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-introduction

AKS_Addon_KeyVaultSecretProvider.explanation: Azure Key Vault secret provider should be used for storing and accessing secrets. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/csi-secrets-store-driver

AKS_Auth_EntraIDIntegrated.explanation: The cluster should be integrated with Azure Active Directory for authentication and authorization. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/enable-authentication-microsoft-entra-id

AKS_Auth_LocalAccountsDisbaled.explanation: Local accounts should be disabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/manage-local-accounts-managed-azure-ad

AKS_Auth_RBACEnabled.explanation: Role-based access control (RBAC) should be enabled in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/operator-best-practices-cluster-security#enable-rbac

AKS_Auth_UserAssignedIdentity.explanation: User-assigned managed identities should be used in the cluster. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-managed-identity

AKS_Auth_WorkloadIdentities.explanation: Workload identities should be used to authenticate to other resources. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/learn/tutorial-kubernetes-workload-identity

AKS_Auth_PodIdentities.explanation: Pod identities are deprecated and should not be used. Leverage workload identities instead. For more information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/learn/tutorial-kubernetes-workload-identity
